text message: That's okay. It can be hard sometime to remember. Next time you notice that your child is beginning to get restless, try distracting them. You can try and play a fun game together!

text message: No problem, try to notice how they respond next time!

name: CheckIn
text message: That is great! As you begin to redirect your child's behaviour regularly, you will begin to notice their behaviour improving!

name: CheckIn
text message: It is completely normal to experience this challenge. Remember, it takes some time for your child to get used to you redirecting their behaviour. The more time you spend with them, the better it will go!

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry to hear that you are finding this challenging. It happens, just be patient. Make sure to continue trying to redirect your child's behaviour. You will see the benefits soon!

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry to hear that you are finding this difficult. Next time try to catch the misbehaviour early on, before it sets in or escalates. You can do this!

name: CheckIn
text message: Sorry to hear that you are finding this difficult. Next time, take a deep breath, take some space, and then pick something very small and concrete that you wish your child could do more of that you can praise in your child. You can do this!

name: CheckIn
text message: That's okay! The more you pay attention to what your child is doing, the easier it will be to catch the bad behaviour before it gets worse and redirect it to a positive behaviour. If you find that you are too busy or not around your child, you can also teach this skill to other caregivers in your family. It's a group effort!

text message: Sorry to hear that you are finding this difficult. You may need to spend more One-on-One Time with your child and give more positive attention to them when they are behaving well. This takes time so be patient!
